body.name: Melissa & Doug Pilot Dashboard

features: Wooden airplane dashboard with lights, buttons, and sound effects; includes play headset
Throttle increases speed of scrolling map; yoke moves plane in the scrolling display
Includes 3 double-sided windshield cards and double-sided reusable pre-flight checklist
22 sounds in all, including night mode, seatbelt, weather options, left/right turn, cabin and tower communications, location selector, local radio, landing gear
Light-up dials include altimeter, horizon, heading, airspeed
body.description: Ready to let imaginations take flight? Roger that! The Jet Pilot Interactive Dashboard features lights, buttons, switches, and sounds to keep kids engaged and immersed in exciting pretend-play adventures. An airplane steering yoke is mounted on a sturdy wooden cockpit dashboard with a snap-on windscreen that fits three double-sided, full-color destination scenes. A four-position throttle plays engine sounds and adjusts the speed of a scrolling map; turn the yoke to move a mini-plane in the scrolling display! Press and hold a button to record a message, and release to play back with voice change. Turn the destination dial to hear “hello” in six different languages (English, Mandarin, French, Hindi, Spanish, Arabic) and press the radio button for music from each destination (U.S., China, France, India, South America, and Africa). Other sound effects include turbo boost, night mode (changes the color of dials, too!), seatbelt, weather options, landing gear, and turning. Light-up dials include altimeter, horizon, heading, and airspeed indicators. Add to the pilot role play experience with the pretend play headset and a reusable takeoff and landing checklist. The dashboard, which has two volume options, requires three AA batteries, not included; the toy automatically turns off after approximately nine minutes of inactivity to prevent battery drain.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Countless Ways to Play From classic wooden toys to realistic pretend play sets, Melissa & Doug products spark imagination and wonder through screen-free, open-ended play! We make well-crafted toys that are developed with care to be passed down from generation to generation or shared family to family. When kids pretend with Melissa & Doug, anything is possible!

Learn “Hello” in 6 Languages Throttle increases speed of scrolling map and yoke moves plane in the scrolling display; destination dial and radio button play “hello” in 6 languages and music from each location. Wonderful Wooden Airplane Buckle up and let imagination take flight with this wooden airplane dashboard with steering yoke, scrolling map, 4-speed throttle, lights, buttons, switches, and sound effects. Realistic Headset Comes with a play headset, reusable takeoff and landing checklist, and 3 double-sided destination windscreen scenes.

With more than three decades of experience, we’re a brand you can trust. Our safe and durable toys inspire imaginative play and are designed to stand the test of time and be passed down through generations. We use wood whenever we can because it’s renewable and durable. To ensure the world has healthy forests AND high-quality wooden toys, we’ve committed to planting 10 million trees by 2030. 100% Screen-Free No screens, no apps, just good wholesome toys for hours of kid-powered fun! Each one of our products is designed to engage children in the joy of imaginative, hands-on play.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute and well made
reviews.reviewText: This is such a fun dashboard for any little one who likes to pretend they are flying. It’s well thought out as far as the details. It has the steering yoke, scrolling map, 4-speed throttle, lights, buttons, switches, and sound effects. In addition there is a sturdy headset and several windscreen scenes. The windscreen does tend to fall off, but is easy to put back on. Overall it has worked out great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This toy is great. My son gets a huge kick out of it, especially the voice recording capability. He’s constantly yelling at “ladies and gentlemen to get their seatbelts on” and then cackling when the toy repeats it back to him. My only complaint is that I wish the windshield were harder to remove and I wish there were a way to store the different windshield views on the toy itself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the favorite gift of Christmas 2023 in my household. Assembly was super simple and it has many neat features built in with the dials. I am blown away by the quality of this product. Also, while it makes noise - it isn’t super loud or high pitched. 10/10 recommend! Worth every penny.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great toy but not at regular price
reviews.reviewText: This is a great toy that has been getting as much attention as a toddler can give. It makes some sounds, but there are not enough features to warrant the high price tag. Luckily I found it on sale. Good toy for pretend play

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a great toy. Very happy with it. It has alot of indepth things that you can play with. Well made.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars OUr granddaughter love it!
reviews.reviewText: Bought for our 3 year old granddaughter, whose dad is a jet aircraft mechanic. My daughter says she loves to fly and talk to the passengers when she's playing with it. It's a little pricey for what it is, but that's Doug and Melissa for you. As long as it holds up for a while (hopefully till her little sister who is 7 months old get around to using it), I'll be happy. I know our granddaughter is, which makes our daughter happy, which makes my wife and I happy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Returned one for manufacturer's defect, and the replacement was defective as well!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Extremely disappointed!My daughter only enjoyed this toy for about an hour when I realized that the rolling scenery was slowly ripping and curling up. It must have been off-center when it was made, so the longer she played with it, the worse it got. See photos.Otherwise, it was quite possibly the best toy we ever purchased for her. So many fun, realistic sounds! Melissa and Doug are known for their quality toys, and I've been buying their products for my children and my preschool classroom for decades!We returned it to get a replacement, and were so excited to get next-day delivery. But when it arrived today, there was this sound straight out of the box. See video.I am going to give it one more try, because she really does love this toy! I hope I've just had very bad luck. Third time is a charm, right?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a great toy
reviews.reviewText: My son loves this and every finds it entertaining!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My daughter really like this toy, she spends a lot of time playing with it. It is colourful and fun. Easy for her to play by herself, amazing variety of things she can do. Sturdy and durable material. Very good product quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My little nephew is really into the Melissa and Doug range, so to be able to get one of there latest premium toys pop up on vine, I was really happy seeing his face light up when I got it out to test with him! Don’t get me wrong the item is no way worth the £100 price tag, but as always you are paying the premium due to the official name! It is however very cool and sits on its own base where you can fly the jet as a pilot! Has all different features, sounds and buttons which does a range of different things. Very solid and will last a good amount of time and can also be cleaned easily when required too. Arrived in a fab retail box which could also wrap up lovely as a gift. I would buy this again :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Its Interactive Dashboard boasts a sleek and enticing design with its black color scheme, resembling a real airplane cockpit. The throttle, controlling the scrolling map's speed, and the yoke that moves the plane within the display, add an immersive element to the experience. The variety of impressive sounds, including turbo boost and landing gear, My personal favorite is the weather button that elicits corresponding weather sounds, adding a remarkably immersive dimension to the play. . The destination dial and radio button greeting in 6 languages enhance the interactivity and educational aspect of the toy. However, the replay value may not be as high as anticipated, as children may lose interest after a few play sessions. Moreover, the price point of over 80 pounds does seem a bit steep for the overall engagement it offers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: A truly lovely toy with a massive (and bizarre) design flaw
reviews.reviewText: I, like a few other reviewers experienced the issue of the picture belt that spins to simulate the plane moving coming off the spool. This happened within around 30 minutes of play time.I took it apart to have a look, and the cause is a bit bizarre. The entire picture belt is printed on sticker paper, and the backing is left on. I thought maybe they'd done this because they'd use the end of the sticker to attach both ends of the belt together, but they don't. They use a piece of cello tape. So there is no reason at all for the belt to be printed on sticker paper. The belt breaks the non-sticky backing quickly gets frayed, which causes the picture belt to get stuck to the rollers and the whole thing comes apart.It's a relatively easy fix as long as the picture belt hasn't gotten damaged. 10 Allen screws and carefully removing the belt from the ruined backing paper, then sticking it to something non-sticky. I used an A3 document holder. Wrap it back round the rollers and stick one end to the other with a bit of tape.For the price though I really can't recommend because it seems inevitable that this will happen, unless some of them don't have the belt printed on sticker paper.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like the product but the product has not come with a battery cover so not safe for ly child to use. Could I please get sent a battery cover and screw? Considering the price I am so disappointed as it was a present.
